properties.areaDesc: Pope, IL; McCracken, KY; Massac, IL; Livingston, KY
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 2 at 11:44AM CST until January 8 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a
flood warning for the following rivers in Illinois...Kentucky...

Ohio River at Paducah affecting Massac...Pope...Livingston and
McCracken Counties

.Heavy rainfall along the Ohio River and many of its tributaries,
including the Tennessee River, is causing the river to rise. The
Ohio River at Paducah is now expected to creep up above its flood
stage of 39 feet and crest around 39.5 feet Monday evening.

The National Weather Service in Paducah, Kentucky has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Ohio River at Paducah.
* from Sunday afternoon to Wednesday morning.
* At 11:00 AM Thursday the stage was 34.0 feet.
* Flood Stage is 39.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Sunday afternoon and continue
to rise to near 39.5 feet by Monday evening. the river will fall
below flood stage by early Wednesday morning.
* Impact...At 39.0 Feet...Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly
bottomland and surrounding low lying areas.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
